(I. D. Macdonald). Every finite p-group has at least p −1 conjugacy classes of maximum size. I. D. Macdonald (Proc. Edinburgh Math. Soc., 26 (1983), 233–239) constructed groups of order 2n for any n ⩾7 with just one conjugacy class of maximum size. Are there any examples with exactly p −1 conjugacy classes of maximum size for odd p?
G. Fern´andez–Alcober
answer: Yes, there are, for p = 3 (A. Jaikin-Zapirain, M. F. Newman, E. A. O’Brien, Israel J. Math., 172, no. 1 (2009), 119–123).
